description.title: Pathogen: clinical or host-associated sample from Mycobacterium tuberculosis
description.comment: This strain was isolated from sputum of patient with MDR-TB participated in 2nd B phase of clinical trials of new drug FS-1. The sputum from patient was collected before the first dose intake (in screening stage). Drug Susceptibility Test on solid and liquid media showed resistance to the 1st-line anti-TB drugs and to some anti-TB-drugs from the 2nd line. This strain was sequenced for studying reversion of sensitivity which was discovered during clinical trials and confirmed in experiment on guinea pigs.

bioprojects.title: Updating the Mycobacterium bovis AF2122/97 reference genome

description.title: Updated reference genome sequence and annotation of Mycobacterium bovis AF2122/97
description.comment: We report an update to the reference genome sequence of the bovine tuberculosis bacillus Mycobacterium bovis AF2122/97 generated using an integrative multi-omics approach. Updates include 42 new coding sequences, 14 modified annotations, 26 single nucleotide polymorphisms and disclosure that the RD900 locus, previously described as absent from the M. bovis AF2122/97 genome, is in fact present.

attributes.name: isolation_source
attributes.value: Mycobacterium bovis subsp. bovis strain AF2122/97. This strain is a fully virulent strain that was isolated in 1997 in the UK from a cow suffering necrotic lesions in lung and bronchomediastinal lymph nodes. The strain was also reported to infect and persist in badgers that are considered to be a significant source of bovine infection.

description.title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis K
description.comment: Mycobacterium tuberculosis K-strain. Sequencing of a representative clinical isolate in Korea. A particular strain of M. tuberculosis belonging to the Beijing family has been isolated most frequently in both a population study and outbreaks of tuberculosis in South Korea. This strain is designated as the K-strain, which is the most-common clinical isolate from tuberculosis patients in South Korea. This strain is sequenced for comparative genomic studies.
